div.p: Greetings. I received your letter yesterday in Aarau, and since you cannot come to us, which we greatly desired, behold, as I had forewarned, Mr. Claudius from Madiis is coming up to you.

He wishes to meet with you alone and therefore asks that you would be so kind as to come to his lodging; for soon after he has spoken with you, he will depart again so that he can be with us tomorrow at the synod or chapter in Brugg.
We left Aarau very late yesterday, so that shortly before nightfall we arrived here in Lenzburg with the prefect, where we also spent the night.
Now I, together with another colleague, am setting out for KÃ¶nigsfelden, where I have no doubt my brother is waiting for me. Farewell.
From the castle in Lenzburg, early morning on the first of June, 1564. Your Haller.
